intro: Beilschmiedia neoletestui, commonly known as the red-fruited beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the lowland rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers followed by bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Beilschmiedia neoletestui typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and has a dense, rounded canopy. Its ecological significance lies in its role as both a habitat provider and a contributor to seed dispersal in its native ecosystems.
